intro: Collomia grandiflora var. axillaris, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
